name: untab
description: üîç A productivity tool to boost your browser workflow!
readme_summary: UnTab is a browser extension designed to enhance user productivity by providing a quick and efficient way to search through open browser tabs and perform common actions using keyboard shortcuts. It aims to streamline tab management, making it easier to navigate and interact with a large number of open tabs.
key_features: Perform common actions with few keystrokes
Supported on Chrome, Firefox, and Edge
No data stored or sent to a server
primary_use_case: Improving browser tab management and search efficiency for users with many open tabs.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian in a vast, futuristic library, effortlessly locating a specific book amidst towering shelves filled with countless volumes. The librarian uses a glowing, magical magnifying glass that highlights the desired book with a bright beam. As the book is found, digital particles representing tab data swirl around it. Subtle UI elements resembling a command palette appear near the librarian's hand, showing search queries and actions. The library shelves are organized with clean lines, and the overall mood is one of organized efficiency and discovery. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style, with a clean, modern aesthetic and vibrant, focused lighting.

name: boden
description: Purely native C++ cross-platform GUI framework for Android and iOS development. https://www.boden.io
readme_summary: Boden is a C++17 cross-platform GUI framework for building native Android and iOS applications. It leverages native OEM widgets for a true native look and feel, ensuring fast performance and battery efficiency.
key_features: Cross-platform development for Android and iOS
primary_use_case: Developing cross-platform mobile applications with a native look and feel using C++.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled artisan in a workshop, using a blueprint labeled 'BODEN' to craft two distinct, perfectly formed statues: one representing a modern Android phone and the other an elegant iPhone. The artisan is shown meticulously assembling native UI components, which are glowing with a subtle digital aura, onto each statue. The background is a clean, bright space with subtle code snippets and UI element icons floating gently in the air, symbolizing the cross-platform nature and C++ foundation. The overall mood is one of precision and creation, with a focus on the seamless integration of native elements. Rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with a clean, vibrant color palette.

name: chaplin
description: A real-time silent speech recognition tool.
readme_summary: Chaplin is a real-time, local silent speech recognition tool that uses visual lip reading to transcribe unspoken words. It leverages pre-trained models and integrates with LLMs to provide corrected text output.
primary_use_case: To transcribe silently mouthed words in real-time without audio input, useful for noisy environments or private communication.
cover_image_prompt: A close-up, conceptual illustration of a person's lips subtly moving, with faint, glowing digital particles emanating from them. These particles are being captured by a stylized, transparent camera lens that acts as a conduit. On the other side of the lens, the particles are being woven into clear, legible text that appears on a minimalist screen. The background is a soft, abstract gradient, keeping the focus on the lip-to-text transformation. Subtle UI elements like a small 'Chaplin' logo and a progress bar are visible on the screen. The overall mood is futuristic and intuitive, rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a cool color palette.

name: OxyMouse
readme_summary: OxyMouse is a Python library designed to generate realistic and varied mouse movements. It offers multiple algorithms to simulate different types of cursor paths, making it useful for applications requiring automated mouse control or realistic user simulation.
key_features: Supports multiple algorithms: bezier, gaussian, perlin, oxy
Generate random coordinates within a viewport
Generate coordinates between two specific points
primary_use_case: Automating mouse movements in Python for tasks such as testing, botting, or simulating user interactions.
cover_image_prompt: A whimsical, anthropomorphic mouse character, dressed as a digital artist, holding a paintbrush that is drawing a smooth, glowing curve across a digital canvas. The canvas displays a stylized representation of a computer screen with a button. The mouse's tail subtly forms the 'OxyMouse' logo. Around the scene, abstract data particles flow from the paintbrush, representing the generated movements. The background is a clean, modern workspace with subtle code snippets visible on a secondary screen. The overall style is a vibrant 3D isometric illustration with a focus on smooth lines and digital aesthetics.
